api_key.description: API Keys can be used as Basic HTTP Authentication credentials and provide a substitute for the account's actual username and password. API Keys are only available to team accounts and there is only 1 key per account. API Keys do not support scopes and have therefore access to all contents of the account.
api_key.name: Authorization

basic.description: Basic HTTP Authentication as per [RFC-2617](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2617) (Digest not supported). Note that Basic Auth with username and password as credentials is only available on accounts that have 2-factor-auth / 2-step-verification disabled. If you use 2fa, you should authenticate using OAuth2 instead.

scopes.account:write: Read and modify your account information
scopes.email: Read your account's primary email address
scopes.issue:write: Read and modify your repositories' issues
scopes.pipeline:variable: Access your repositories' build pipelines and configure their variables
scopes.pipeline:write: Access and rerun your repositories' build pipelines
scopes.project: Read your workspace's project settings and read repositories contained within your workspace's projects
scopes.project:write: Read and modify your workspace's project settings, and read and transfer repositories within your workspace's projects
scopes.pullrequest: Read your repositories and their pull requests
scopes.pullrequest:write: Read and modify your repositories and their pull requests
scopes.team:write: Read and modify your team membership information
scopes.webhook: Read and modify your repositories' webhooks
scopes.wiki: Read and modify your repositories' wikis
